s.text: While I have cordial but hardly warm relations with several co-workers, the only person I genuinely like is a woman who was hired about eight months ago.

She can see the phone, she can hear us talking, yet she bursts in, unwilling to wait.
As for revealing your strikeout record, that kind of information always gets out during the course of what Prudie refers to as the "what did you major in?"
Prudie, a classically trained salon-goer, recommends a grand gift at Christmastime.

Since we only live once until further notice, Prudie thinks it would be a shame to pass up a promising romantic opportunity simply because it may not turn out to be perfect--or permanent.
